result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. George Edward Norman III

records.addlTxt:
Defendant George Edward Norman III in court.  Attorney Michael F. Hart in court for George Edward Norman III.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Discovery issues put forth on the record. Court schedules the next court date for a status conference date and sets 11/28/2022 as the deadline to file any motions. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant George Edward Norman III appeared by video. Attorney Morgan Minter appeared for Attorney Michael F. Hart by video for George Edward Norman III.   Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 078800,
Payable Number: 1026270,
Receipt Number: 22RP032911,
Amount: $20.00
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.

Defendant George Edward Norman in court with attorney Michael F. Hart.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/16/22 @ 1p
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on August 16, 2022, at 1:00 PM.  jm
